body:
I think I know the issue, testing it out. This will require a HOTFIX, look
for PR shortly.

On Fri, Oct 30, 2015 at 4:06 PM, Ashish Singh asingh@cloudera.com wrote:

> Weird, nothing special should be needed. Trying to reproduce.
> 
> On Fri, Oct 30, 2015 at 3:53 PM, Gwen (Chen) Shapira <
> notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> > Do I need to set up anything special to run the tests?
> > 
> > The PLAINTEXT tests pass, but SSL fails with "Timed out waiting to
> > consume expected number of messages."
> > 
> > —
> > Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> > https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/319#issuecomment-152669109.
> 
> ## 
> 
> Regards,
> Ashish

## 

Regards,
Ashish
@gwenshap could you commit this. I think it got in by mistake in https://github.com/apache/kafka/commit/1cc44830b90688f1a2034243b8ee03b97101f75c
@gwenshap after #395 gets committed, it should work fine. https://github.com/apache/kafka/commit/1cc44830b90688f1a2034243b8ee03b97101f75c got in between I rebased my changes and you tried this.

Thanks for this Jason. I had a quick look via my phone and I noticed that there are still two TODOs on the integration test. Worth checking (if you haven't) if they can be addressed. And the package name on the integration test has been wrong since its introduction, maybe you can fix it.
@ijuma Still working on it. Just wanted to get the initial PR out there.
Thanks Rajini. Do the tests pass if you remove the setConfiguration(null) call in isZKSecurityEnabled?
Great.

LGTM.

Sorry for missing this in my previous review.
This is to set new-consumer to true if SSL is specified, which makes sense to me (since SSL is not supported in old consumers).
@ijuma  Yes, tests do pass without the `setConfiguration(null)` in `isZkSecurityEnabled`. I have removed it and pushed an update.
Great, thanks.

@onurkaraman @jjkoshy @becketqin Thanks much for taking time to review the patch! I have updated the patch so that we don't introduce yammer dependency to new producer and new consumer. With the latest patch, server will have 2 additional jmx metrics with name kafka-metrics-total and yammer-metrics-total. New producer and new consumer will  have 1 additional jmx metrics named kafka-metrics-total. Old consumer will have 1 additional metrics named yammer-metrics-total.

I have tested the patch with server, new producer and old consumer. The patch works as expected. Can you please have another look?
LGTM. New tests pass.
@gwenshap Would you have time to review this patch? It may be useful to include in 0.9 release since it fixes a bug in log cleaner.

Super sorry @lindong28, but I just don't know enough about the cleaner to properly review this. 
I hope @guozhangwang, @junrao or @jjkoshy will have time.

I got the following two errors when running the unit tests locally.

kafka.zk.ZKEphemeralTest > testOverlappingSessions[0] FAILED
    org.scalatest.junit.JUnitTestFailedError: Secure access not enabled
        at org.scalatest.junit.AssertionsForJUnit$class.newAssertionFailedException(AssertionsForJUnit.scala:102)
        at org.scalatest.junit.JUnitSuite.newAssertionFailedException(JUnitSuite.scala:79)
        at org.scalatest.Assertions$class.fail(Assertions.scala:1328)
        at org.scalatest.junit.JUnitSuite.fail(JUnitSuite.scala:79)
        at kafka.zk.ZKEphemeralTest.setUp(ZKEphemeralTest.scala:61)

kafka.security.auth.ZkAuthorizationTest > testIsZkSecurityEnabled FAILED
    java.lang.AssertionError
        at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:86)
        at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:41)
        at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:52)
        at kafka.security.auth.ZkAuthorizationTest.testIsZkSecurityEnabled(ZkAuthorizationTest.scala:56)
Thanks for the patch. LGTM
@junrao Thanks for the review! @gwenshap Thanks:)

Try reverting the change and running log4j-appender system tests. I am
planning to investigate the need of this dependency as part of KAFKA-2716.

On Fri, Oct 30, 2015 at 7:00 PM, Manikumar Reddy O <notifications@github.com

> wrote:
> 
> @SinghAsDev https://github.com/SinghAsDev I did this change to remove
> the dependency. Can you tell me where log4j-appender is not getting built?
> I ran ./gradlew build, ./gradlew jar, ./gradlew release.. I am able to
> build log4j-appender.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/395#issuecomment-152686335.

## 

Regards,
Ashish

@junrao The tests weren't failing for me, but that could be due to the order in which they are run. I have added `setConfiguration(null)` to the setup methods. In case they still fail for you, can you let me which JDK you are using and whether the tests fail when run on their own? Thanks.
@junrao @guozhangwang (and @ijuma if he has time): Ping for review.
Thanks for the patch. LGTM
@granders  Thank you for the review. I have made the updates.

I left a question on the original jira but it looks like it got lost among the updates here:

Regarding the schema evolution: what was the reason for making v1 represent offset schema and v2 represent group schema? I think we did a similar pattern for OffsetFetchRequest and OffsetCommitRequest (where one version represented commits to zookeeper and another represented commits to kafka), but I think circumstances were different in that kafka-based offset storage was meant to replace zookeeper-based offset storage.
@Parth-Brahmbhatt can you review this as well.

@onurkaraman The reason for using key version as the message type indicator is that log compactor will compact different versions of the same data type (they will have different value version but the same key version), but not compact different data types together.

@junrao @hachikuji @onurkaraman Ping for another round of reviews.

Besides addressing comments the major changes are with `GroupCoordinatorResponseTest`: mokcing on the replica manager lever and adding EasyMock.capture for store offsets and groups.

Thanks for the patch. Looks good overall. Just a few minor comments. In AuthorizerIntegrationTest, could we add a couple of more tests.
1. Producer.send(() should get an AuthorizationException on an existing topic without the describe permission. This can be achieved by setting up an ACL on the topic to a user other than anonymous.
2. Consumer.poll() should get an AuthorizationException on an existing topic without the describe permission. This can be achieved by setting up an ACL on the topic to a user other than anonymous.
3. In testProduceNeedsAuthorization(), could we just catch AuthorizationException instead of ApiException? Then we probably don't need to check the message string.

@junrao Thanks for the review. I'm also looking at offset commits, which currently aren't covered. They're an interesting case because a commit can be rejected either because the user is not authorized to the group or to the topic. But since we only have one generic authorization error, clients cannot tell which case actually happened. This is probably not a major problem (more of an annoyance really), but I wonder if we should have different error codes for each resource type?

Thanks for the patch. I have two general thoughts about the public APIs of `KafkaConsumer`:

1) in `poll` function, we could first document there are two types of general exceptions: ApiException (only for "non-retriable" error codes returned from brokers) and WakeupException. Then we could list all possible ApiExceptions and state that user only need to special handle different types ApiExceptions when necessary. This is just to clear the confusion that we expose all kinds of failures to users.

Also rep. to the above comment, to simplify the exception list, I would actually prefer only having an `AuthorizationException` and incorporate the authorization error scope (be it topic, group, etc) in the error message. The motivation is that since this exception is considered FATAL and cannot be resolved programmatically even at the app level, users would then not care about the scope in the code but just want to see the error message thrown upon encountering this and have ops resolution then.

2) in `commit` function, incorporate possible exceptions into a single `CommitFailedException` (this can be thrown directly in commitSync, or indirectly from commitAsync's callback) with different error types encoded in the error message. My motivation is the same as above.

@guozhangwang TopicAuthorizationException and GroupAuthorizationException extend from AuthorizationException, so we can still list just AuthorizationException on the poll() API. I think it's better having the explicit exceptions in particular because it is useful in testing. Otherwise you have to resort to hacky error message assertions.
Also created https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-2720 to keep track of the periodic group purging.

@hachikuji : For offset commit, for now, perhaps we can just return the same error code and on the client side, put in a more general error message in AuthorizationException (sth like the client may not have the read permission on either the topic or the consumer group).
@junrao Ready for another look.

1. When the last member leaves the group, we need to delete the group by writing the tombstone to the offset topic. So, it seems that in GroupCoordinator.onMemberFailure(), we should call GroupMetadataManager.removeGroup()?
2. Do we have unit tests that cover the loading of both the offsets and the groups metadata from the offset topic?
Test failure is unrelated to this patch.
Thanks for the patch. Other than making DescribeGroup take an array of groups, it looks good.
Thanks for the patch. LGTM. Jus a few minor comments.
@junrao This seems a problem that needs to fix in 0.9. The patch is not big. Do you mind take a look?
@junrao Added a couple commits to rename GroupMetadataRequest to GroupCoordinatorRequest and allow DescribeGroup to work with multiple groups.
LGTM, thanks.

I agree with Gwen that this behavior seems reasonable; also it would be good to check usage of the constructor to see if any usages rely on this behavior (I suspect some benchmark tests might rely on this). 

Perhaps rather than deleting this `if` block, we could just log the change to make it more visible?

Rep. Jun 1): when `removeGroup()` is called on the last member of the group, it will first enter the "PrepareRebalance" state, and then directly trigger `onCompleteJoin` since the purgatory's delayed request can be completed immediately with no members. Hence we are effectively always call `removeGroup` as in `onCompleteJoin`. This code is just for making the state machine diagram more clear.

2). We have the unit tests for various coordinator responses that have been updated in this patch with `ReplicaManager.appendMessages` mock to test basic functions of `GroupMetadataManager`. For further integration tests that requires a full-fledged replica manager and coordinator / group manager we will include it in KAFKA-1326.

I too agree that it is reasonable behavior :). It is just that it will
never be exercised as new_consumer is by default set to false. So, one can
not just set security_protocol and expect that new_consumer will be set
automatically. It used to be that case, however that changed in
https://github.com/apache/kafka/commit/e6b343302f3208f7f6e0099fe2a7132ef9eaaafb,
unless I am missing something.

On Mon, Nov 2, 2015 at 11:41 AM, Geoff notifications@github.com wrote:

> I agree with Gwen that this behavior seems reasonable; also it would be
> good to check usage of the constructor to see if any usages rely on this
> behavior (I suspect some benchmark tests might rely on this).
> 
> Perhaps rather than deleting this if block, we could just log the change
> to make it more visible?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/396#issuecomment-153135828.

## 

Regards,
Ashish

@rajinisivaram Thanks for the changes, looks good

Were failures you mentioned here (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-2719) affecting runs of the tests?

Good point, that is my fault :) In that case,  maybe change the signature back to default to to `new_consumer=None` and update the comment to reflect the fact that if `new_consumer` is not set, its value will be determined by choice of security protocol?

@granders After my final rebase, my local test runs started failing and hence I ran the tests with the fix in KAFKA-2719. The system test runs in http://jenkins.confluent.io/ were failing to provision VMs over the weekend and there were failures in the last periodic system test run from kafka trunk. So I didn't want to run my branch in case they broke other tests running there.

I am fine with your suggestion. I was just not sure about the intention
behind changing the default, so I suggested to remove this.

On Mon, Nov 2, 2015 at 12:12 PM, Geoff notifications@github.com wrote:

> Good point, that is my fault :) In that case, maybe change the signature
> back to default to to new_consumer=None and update the comment to reflect
> the fact that if new_consumer is not set, its value will be determined by
> choice of security protocol?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/396#issuecomment-153143409.

## 

Regards,
Ashish
Jenkins failures seem to be unrelated to this change. @guozhangwang
Thanks, LGTM.
The test failure is irrelevant.
LGTM. Thanks.
Thanks, LGTM!
Thanks for the patch. For consistency, should we use wildcard classpath for running the released Kafka as well?

@ewencp Addressed most review comments. One question is what is the best name for backoff. Currently, at the HDFS connector side, the failure time is recorded and we only proceed to actual retry when the backoff is reached.

@SinghAsDev An update on the dependency tickets: we are likely to have both 2017 and 2687 merged soon (maybe tonight or tomorrow) by myself and @hachikuji , and we would love to have this ticket rebased / reviewed and merged as soon as possible right after these two are done since our target release date is next week. If you do not have enough time to rebase it please let me know so that we can help on the rest of the work.

Thanks for being so patient :)

@Ishiihara Not sure about the name. Maybe `backoff` works. Could also be something like `timeout` or `schedule`. `Timeout` might be better as `schedule` isn't really ever associated with spurious wakeups, whereas `timeouts` sometimes are.
@ewencp Added backoff reset.
@gwenshap Pretty small, but adds a few key features for sink connectors and looks ok to me. Care to take a look? If you have opinions about naming, see discussion of `backoff` vs other terms above.
@guozhangwang thanks for the heads up. I will be ready :).
The editor I used added a lot of metadata, I'm working on removing this, but the text itself should be ok.

@junrao As discussed, I added a different error code for each resource type. This makes testing and exception handling easier for the couple ambiguous cases. It would be nice to get some feedback from @harshach on this.
Thanks for the patch. LGTM. Just a couple of minor comments.

Two minor comments and LGTM!

Great explanation of both rationale and actions.
@ewencp @gwenshap Just updated the related doc.
@SinghAsDev Seems like the patch for ListGroups/DescribeGroup (#388) is not going to change significantly, so you could probably get started if you want.
LGTM

Sure, will start on it tonight.

On Mon, Nov 2, 2015 at 4:50 PM, hachikuji notifications@github.com wrote:

> @SinghAsDev https://github.com/SinghAsDev Seems like the patch (#388
> https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/388) is not going to change
> significantly, so you could probably get started if you want.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/299#issuecomment-153206840.

## 

Regards,
Ashish
Thanks for the patch. LGTM. Just a minor comment.
@ewencp @gwenshap Refactor the code to move some methods to `WorkerSInkTaskContext` in `runtime`.  The connector will only be able to access the setter methods.
@rajinisivaram I just chatted with Jun - he's ok with the PR as long as you address his comment. Then I think we can move forward with finalizing the SASL test patch.
@guozhangwang Could you take a look?
@junrao @granders PR has been updated to address Jun's comment.

@guozhangwang, relying upon the existing producer partitioning mechanism is acceptable, although IMO it is still less usable, especially in some situations. Feel free to close this and the JIRA issue.
LGTM
Do we need to add ZK sasl authentication to consumer tests? The new consumer no longer depends on ZK.

But the brokers talk to ZK. These tests are exercising basic production and consumption of messages when the communication broker-zk is authenticated. It is a cheap of testing this functionality given that the test cases are there already.
@hachikuji there are quite a few merge issues when I pull in #388 , I will wait for those issues to get resolved.
@SinghAsDev Apologies, should finish rebasing shortly.
LGTM, with some questions on the latest commit itself.
LGTM except one minor comment.
LGTM
@guozhangwang I tried several times to reproduce the test failure, but haven't been able to. It doesn't appear to be related to this patch.
@gwenshap this is worth taking a look. Not a blocker, but affects users and is probably on most common users' path.

LGTM, just one minor comment.

Jenkins failures are not related.
#388 has been merged.

@onurkaraman @guozhangwang Ping for review. I made LeaveGroup best effort and only logged any errors. I also added a close(timeout) method on KafkaConsumer which mirrors the same method for KafkaProducer to give more control to users over shutdown. I'm adding additional test cases at the moment.

@rajinisivaram @junrao 
Tests are passing, with the exception of a couple copycat tests that were already failing on trunk:
http://jenkins.confluent.io/job/kafka_system_tests_branch_builder/139/artifact/results/latest/report.html

So this LGTM to me
Thanks for the patch @vesense , we are currently shooting to get the 0.9.0 release by next week. I will come back to review this PR right after it is done.
@junrao Rebased against trunk.
Were you also planning on adding `void close(long timeout, TimeUnit unit)` to the Consumer interface?
@onurkaraman Yeah, if we accept that method here, we probably should.
Thanks @apovzner for the patch. Looks good to me overall, left some minor comments.
Thanks for the patch. LGTM.
@guozhangwang Could you please check my change with volatile? Thanks a lot for your comments.
@ijuma Was there any reason for not allowing capital letters?
